Ran into a bunch of issues related to cleanup after failure...
i.e the first iteration of running the script failed because there was a duplicate issue with fixVersion set.
I fixed this, and then it failed because it already created a branch. After removing the branch, it failed because it already created the tag.

We can decide if we want to deal with existing stuff or cleanup on exit.

More feedback:
* Of all the different things I need to manually enter or configure in advance, the base branch is hardcoded to trunk?
* I'm kinda tired of typing or copy-pasting same things over and over again. I know it is a bit much, but I'd love it to save what I entered somewhere so I wouldn't need to keep telling it where my two java homes are.

@ijuma Thanks for the PR. LGTM.

Just to clarify - we need to merge this into both trunk and 0.10.2 and roll out a new RC?
If we need a new RC, can you please comment on the email vote thread?
Needs a few more test cases to test log rotation, stdin special case, and file update between restarts.

A few other minor things with this readme in general:

https://github.com/mjsax/kafka/blame/ccd0c20f5ff5dd8825e0fdd76c264c83987ec61e/tests/README.md#L388

that line should link to http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user.html. We're not creating a user, we're creating a role (or at least all the information below it belongs to IAM roles)

https://github.com/mjsax/kafka/blame/ccd0c20f5ff5dd8825e0fdd76c264c83987ec61e/tests/README.md#L396

the security group that should be created needs to be an EC2 security group not an IAM group. ie some explanation that you need to go to use the EC2 instance console/command, not IAM.

https://github.com/mjsax/kafka/blame/ccd0c20f5ff5dd8825e0fdd76c264c83987ec61e/tests/README.md#L401

We should mention that you are now creating a new EC2 instance with the ubuntu AMI. Even something simple like `Create the Test Driver EC2 Instance` would be bawes.

@junrao @ijuma  I changed the warning Ismael mentioned to an assert and fixed up the tests appropriately. Jira updated. 

Scheduled system tests for core: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/ build:835
